role_info: From left to right are Joey Tribbiani, Chandler Bing, Rachel Green, and Monica Geller.

conversations.value: All right, Mon, check this out! What do you think they're all looking at, huh? It's like that time we all saw that dog wearing a tiny raincoat and boots.

Oh my God, that was adorable! But look at their faces here, it's got to be something really intense. Knowing us, it's probably a marathon of Jeopardy, and the final question is about some super obscure food that only I would know.
Ha! Speaking of food, Rach looks like she's just spotted a cheesecake on the ground floor window ledge! You remember what happened last time...
Don't even remind me! I'm still not over that cheesecake fiasco. And Joey, if that's a sandwich out there, what would you do?
I'd pull a 'Hombre', dash out, grab that sandwich, and be back before the commercial break ends! Oh, and you know "Joey doesn't share food," right?

Yes, Joey, we've established that you don't share food like a million times. But if I had to guess, I'd say Chandler's just come up with another one of his sarcastic comments, and I'm probably about to hit him with a cushion.
I'd bet my 'Days of Our Lives' DVD collection on that! Hey, you think if we made a bet about this, people would enter a contest to guess what we're all lookin' at?

Knowing you, you'd lose that DVD collection in a heartbeat. And no more betting, Joey, we've had enough of that for a lifetime. Remember what happened last time we bet on who could throw a paper ball into the trash can from across the room?
Fine, no bets. But I've gotta say, we do look pretty good in this picture, don't we? I mean, if this acting thing doesn't work out for me, I could always be a professional looker-at-things!
Just keep smiling like that, Joey, and you'll be a star! Now, let's figure out what we were all staring at and make sure it's not another cat singing "Smelly Cat" outside the window.

role_info: From left to right are Rachel Green and Ross Geller.
scene_info: They become sober and decide to cancel marriage.

conversations.value: Oh my Goddess, Mon, look at this photo! It’s like Ross and Rachel are reenacting some sort of Las Vegas-themed Greek tragedy. Remind me again, why were they in Vegas?
That was just classic Ross and Rachel, Phoebe. They were there to visit Joey, remember? And of course, those two ended up having way more Vegas-style fun than they planned.

Fun? Ross looks like he just saw a ghost, or worse, a premonition of every marriage he'll ever have. And Rachel’s expression is like when you open a yogurt and it’s watery on top, but you know, times a million.
Well, it was the morning after, you know. They got drunk, had some spontaneous nuptials. Typical Ross and Rachel shenanigans. Thank goodness, they sorted it out.
I still can't believe they went through a wedding. I mean, it's so impulsive, so... actually, it's sort of romantic in a weird way, don’t you think? If you squint?
Romantic? Phoebe, they had Sharpie-drawn faces and couldn't even remember getting married. Although, I guess they did love each other enough to get married even when they were completely wasted…
Yes, exactly! It's their subconscious love bubbling to the surface. Like when I write songs in my sleep, but instead of awakening to “Smelly Cat's Cousin”, they got a marriage license.
Only you would find the romance in a drunken mistake, Pheebs. But hey, at least we got to see them have a hilarious adventure. "The One in Vegas" is gonna be a story for the ages.
You’re right, I mean, who needs a 'pla' when you have spontaneity! Though, I wonder what their kids will think when they tell this story...
Knowing Ross, he'll probably have a three-part presentation with charts. And Rachel will just cringe and laugh. But it's okay, I'll make sure to tell the twins the story, so it lives on forever.
You mean you’ll add the ‘Monica Clean’ version of the story. The PG, dishwasher-safe version.
What can I say, Phoebe? I like to keep things clean, even the stories!

role_info: From left to right are Phoebe Buffay, Monica Geller, Chandler Bing and Rachel Green.
scene_info: Rachel doesn't want to admit to being pregnant, and Phoebe says she is pregnant.

conversations.value: Look at this picture, Monica! Remember this moment? You were such a beautiful bride, like a delicate flower just waiting to be pollinated. But, hey, why does Rachel look like she swallowed a big, old secret?
Aww, thank you, Phoebe! I felt like a princess. And Rachel, well, we all know now she was definitely hiding her pregnancy. I can't believe she thought she could keep it from us for so long.

Yeah, but remember I totally knew! I have this sixth sense for pregnancy—I can feel the baby vibes. It’s like a maternal ESP. Plus, her face was so telling, just like my Aunt Mary who was famous in our family for guessing pregnancies. Or was it her cookie recipe? Anyway...

Phoebe, how do you always manage to sense these things? It’s uncanny. You were right about Rachel being pregnant and, do you remember, you even predicted that weird rainstorm on my wedding day. I swear you have some kind of weather-altering powers too.

Monica, I told you, it’s the Buffay blood. We’re part witch, part psychic, and part... I don’t know, normal person who really likes sandwiches? Anyway, it was magical how everything turned out perfect, even with the rainstorm. Speaking of magic, how did you manage to stay so calm throughout everything?

Honestly? I don’t know if I was calm or just numb from painfully smiling so long in those pictures. Plus, having my best friend confess she was pregnant to cover up for Rachel's secret? That was a twist better than any soap opera could write.
Yeah, at that moment, I was Phoebe Buffay: psychic, semi-psychotic, and pretend-pregnant! I should’ve milked that a little bit longer. Maybe gotten a foot massage out of Joey or something.

Pheebs... Joey would've probably gotten you a pizza instead. You know he could never keep track of those kinds of things. But hey, let's get some frames for this photo, and every time we look at it, we'll remember the buffet of craziness from that day.

Yes, let’s honor our buffet with a buffet. A photo buffet! Because every time I see this picture, I want to throw a party and celebrate how we’ve all grown... and especially for my uncanny ability to intercept cosmic baby signals.
You got it, Pheebs. We’ll have a photo buffet with a side of your famous maternity ESP predictions. Now, let’s get some of your delicious cookies and plan this thing properly. Monica style!

role_info: From left to right are Monica Geller holding a baby, Joey Tribbiani behind her, Chandler Bing, Phoebe Buffay, Rachel Green and Ross Geller.
scene_info: Rose and Rachel's daughter Emma's first birthday party.

conversations.value: Oh look, Monica, is that the infamous 'Seven! Seven! Seven!' onesie that you made for Emma's first birthday? It's so cute the way she's gawking at it, like she totally gets the reference!

Yes! Can you believe it? I swear, she has my compulsive cleanliness gene too. I dropped a spoon, and she looked at it like it was contaminated. And let's be honest, an appreciation for a good 'Seven!' at such a young age? She's clearly a Geller.

Speaking of contaminated, reminds me of the time when I dropped my guitar in Central Perk and I had to cleanse it with sage. But seriously, would this be a good moment to sing 'Smelly Cat' to Emma? Maybe we can give her a promising musical debut on her birthday.

I think "Smelly Cat" might be more appropriate for when she's a bit older and can truly appreciate the complex emotional undertones. Plus, the cats in the song are probably not up to her hygiene standards. Speaking of hygiene, did you notice how mirroring it is that Bing and Tribbiani manage to stay one step away from Emma's range of spit-up?

Definitely. It's like they have this scientific 'Spit-Up Avoidance Technique.' Hey, if only Ross could explain that with his dinosaur stories! And look at Rachel, she's got this 'I'm a hat' vibe going on while holding Emma. It's like she defies the whole 'You're a shoe' predestiny thing.

That's classic Rachel. Always rewriting her own story. And it's amazing that Joey still manages to look like an Italian stallion, even while lurking behind me like a giggly giant. Remember when he thought 'Gigawatt' was a real word?
Don't even get me started. It's like "Oh, no, Joey—not everything that sounds Italian is Italian." But really, this picture is just missing a dinosaur in a party hat to make it completely surreal.

Absolutely. It would be just like a typical day in our lives—defying reality, one birthday at a time. And speaking of birthdays, we should totally start planning yours! Are you thinking more along the lines of massages and mysticism or music and mayhem?

Hmm, why not both? Maybe a cleansing ritual followed by a session of "Massaging the Melody"? Get it? Gosh, I'd kill for a gig like that. Anyway, look at this photo. It's one for the ages. It screams family, friends, and... that unmistakable Chandler smirk. Classic!

role_info: From top to bottom are Ross Geller, Joey Tribbiani, Rachel Green and Phoebe Buffay.
scene_info: They are begging to let them in.

conversations.value: Look at that! Don't they just look like a set of hilarious matryoshka dolls?
I never thought I'd see the day where Ross's head would be the biggest thing coming through my door.
Right? And Joey with that mischievous grin. It's like he's plotting to steal my grandma's cookie recipe again.
Pheebs, he doesn't need to plot. Your cookie recipe is probably safer with the Cookie Monster than in our kitchen.
True. But look at Rachel, all sweet and innocent. She's totally using her 'We were on a break' eyes to get in.
Yeah, well, it always works on Ross. I guess she's hoping it'll work on the door, too.
You know, if I didn't know any better, I'd say they were trying to escape from something. Maybe it's my turn to be the one who lives inside the apartment and everyone is desperate to get out!
Well, if it's a 'Phoebe’s spooky story' session, I wouldn’t blame them for escaping.
Hey! My stories are not spooky, they're... enlightening. Besides, that's clearly a 'let us in' plea. Do you think it's my professional curious tension that's scaring them?
It's probably more to do with the fact that I've got the last piece of cheesecake hidden in the fridge and they can smell it from out there.

Oh my God, that's like the most delicious trap ever. But you know what’s funny? They all look like they have a secret. Rach is like 'I’m gonna get that cheesecake' and Ross's face is 'I don’t eat dessert' but we all know he’s lying.
Yeah, every single one of them would barge in here for that. And Joey looks like he’s already planning the victory dance he’ll do once he gets his hands on it.
So, are we going to let them in, or should we just stand here guessing their next moves? We could make it a game!
I have a game in mind. It's called 'How long can Monica tease them before sharing her cheesecake'. I'm competitive, remember?
I know. Your competitive side is scarier than any Halloween tale I could ever come up with.
That's the spirit, Pheebs. Alright, on the count of three, we open the door and see who makes it to the cheesecake first. I bet it’s Ross.
Let the Hunger Games begin! But if it's Ross, I'm going to call him Cheesecakeasaurus for a month.

role_info: From left to right are Chandler Bing on the phone, Ross Geller and Joey Tribbiani.
scene_info: They are persuading Chandler to resign, but he gets a higher paying job instead.

conversations.value: Oh hey, Mon, check this out, this was the day Chandler almost quit his job but ended up getting a raise instead. Remember how crazy that was?
Oh my God, yes! And there's you with a sandwich, of course. Could you BE any more predictable?
Hey! Joey doesn't share food, but he does share memories. Besides, you know I love a good meatball sub. And look at Ross, all serious and supportive. Classic Ross.
It's funny, I always knew Chandler hated his job, but he never had the guts to quit. It's so typical of him to fall backwards into a promotion.
He's like the luckiest guy, right? But hey, if it wasn't for that, you guys might never have gotten the house with the big yard for the twins.
That's true. In a weird way, this was like a turning point for all of us. You with your acting, me and Chandler starting a family. It's kind of sweet when you think about it.
Yeah, it's like we're all growing up or something. By the way, how do you keep your place so clean with two kids? It's like a Monica clean level of impossible.
Oh please, you know me, it's like a reflex. And hey, speaking of clean, would it kill you to use a plate?
Eh, less dishes to wash. Plus, you know me, I'm a simple guy. Sandwich, beer, good TV show – I'm all set.
Simple, yes, but you always know how to make us laugh. I still can't believe how much has changed since then. Do you miss the old days?

Of course, I do! But hey, we've got new good days ahead, right? Like, who knows, maybe my next audition will be the one. Or maybe I'll finally get to eat at your restaurant and not have to pretend I'm not Joey.
If you promise to actually pay this time, you're welcome anytime, Joey. You know, I'm really proud of how far we've all come.
And I'm proud of you, too, Mon. Who knew, huh? From a shoe to a hat, and everything in between.
Thank you, Joey. It's never a dull moment with you around. Let's promise to keep making memories, okay?
You got it. How you doin' on that promise to keep making memories with me?
Oh Joey, never change.

role_info: From left to right are Emily in a wedding dress, godfather and Ross Geller.
place_info: Ross and Emily's wedding in London
scene_info: Ross mistakenly calls his fiancée Emily Rachel.

conversations.value: Look at this photo! Isn't it just like a fairy-tale wedding, until, you know, it wasn't?
Yeah, it was so beautiful. The flowers, the dress... But, oh God, can you imagine? "I, Ross, take thee, Rachel" – the one wedding vow to rule them all.

Yeah, it's like if 'Smelly Cat' was a wedding, it started off cute but ended up being kind of sad. I still can't believe he said the wrong name. That's something you'd expect to happen in one of my nightmares, where everything goes wrong... and you're a giant pigeon, for some reason.

I still feel so bad for Emily. And Ross! I mean, you could literally see his heart jump out of his chest and try to run away. But honestly, between you and me, a part of me knew they weren't really meant to be, you know?

Totally! I mean, they barely knew each other. And hey, if I ever get married again, I'm making sure we're all on a first-name basis. Plus, if Mike ever said the wrong name, I'd just be like, "Hi, I'm Regina Phalange, and you are...?"

Classic Phoebe. But seriously, I think it's crucial to get to know each other really well first. Like, when Chandler and I decided to get married, we were best friends first. That's why I wear oven mitts now, so there's no room for slip-ups with names!
Oven mitts, huh? Maybe you're on to something. It’s like, instead of a veil, let’s just cover everything up. Hands, face, the works. A total mystery bride.
Yeah, and then the groom doesn't know who he's marrying until it's done. Surprise! It's Monica! Or Phoebe... Or Regina?
A wedding twist! Oh, can you imagine the look on their faces? It'll be fun! You know, like a game show, but with a marriage license at the end.
Imagine if we did that with Ross's next wedding…  I just hope there's not an Emily, a Julie, a Rachel, or a Rebecca in the room when he says his vows next time.
Yeah, maybe we should just make him a T-shirt with the right name on it. It's foolproof! And if nothing else works, I always have my guitar. Music soothes the savage groom!
Perfect plan, Pheebs! And this time, we will have a backup sign that says 'Say NO!', just in case.
Right? Because when it comes to weddings, sometimes you have to handle it with song, signage, and a little bit of spirit world intervention. I'll have my crystals ready.
I'll hold you to it, Phoebe. I wouldn't want to miss that for the world. Not even if I had a dozen lasagnas in the oven.

role_info: From left to right are Chandler Bing and Ross Geller.
scene_info: They tried to act cool on Thanksgiving Day during college.

conversations.value: Oh wow, look at this! Remember when Ross and Chandler had hair like that? They're giving off some serious '80s vibes. I'm getting a feeling of... nostalgia mixed with... confusion?
Oh my God, I know! Look at Chandler’s Flock of Seagulls hairdo! And Ross is just... Ross. I can’t believe they thought they were so cool. It’s like they decided to have a ‘bad hair day’ contest!
I know right! They look like they belong in one of those bands that only has one hit and then disappears, except their hit was just... their hair.
It's actually kind of adorable. They were trying so hard. I'll never let Ross live this down. This is like the time he made us watch his "sound" on the keyboard. Classic Ross.
"Adorable" might be stretching it. More like a fashion emergency! Thank goodness there were no smelly cat performances that night, my song might've got lost in the... hair-forest.
Phoebe, you would have made any night better with "Smelly Cat," even with those hair-don'ts. And speaking of disasters, look at the clothes! I mean, the jackets, they're almost another character!
Totally! If clothes could talk, those jackets would be screaming, "Help, I'm stuck in the '80s and I can't get out!" So, does Ross still cling to any of those... treasures?
Thankfully, no. He keeps his clothes pretty current now. But I bet you somewhere deep in Chandler's closet, there's still a pair of those acid-wash jeans just waiting for a comeback.
If that happens, I'm staging a fashion intervention! Or better yet, I'll cleanse the apartment with sage. Actually, that could take a while. Maybe I'll just stick to the intervention.

If you do, count me in. But knowing Chandler, he'd probably enjoy the attention even if it's because of his fashion choices. Oh wait. Remember, Chandler wore my pink bunny costume once? So I think he's beyond fashion help.
Well, you can't say they weren't bold. Anyway, we should totally frame this and hang it on the wall. It's like a hilarious cautionary tale!
Absolutely! It will be our little 'museum of hair horrors' exhibit. I can already see Ross's face when he sees this hanging next to the foosball table.
Definitely. And you can tell people that it's an ancient artifact. Like, "Here are the remains of the Lesser-Spotted Hair Ross and the Chandlerus Ridiculous."
Phoebe, only you could come up with that. And you know I'm so going to say that. Okay, it's a plan. Our own 'hall of hair fame' right in the living room.

role_info: From left to right are Phoebe Buffay, Rachel Green, Chandler Bing and Monica Geller. Joey Tribbiani is in the sand in front.

conversations.value: Oh my God, Monica, do you remember this day at the beach cottage? Look at Joey buried in the sand! What was he even trying to do?

Ross, how could I forget? He was insisting that he could be a mermaid—or, well, a merman—because apparently, that's way manlier. And, I swear, the sand was never the same after that. I had to clean for days!
Ha! Classic Joey. And you, of course, dealing with the "Monica clean" aftermath. But hey, look at Chandler's smile. I don't think I've ever seen him look so relaxed cutting vegetables.

Yeah, until he almost chopped his finger off. It was only relaxing because I was supervising. I mean, giving Chandler a knife is like, well, giving you a basketball and expecting you not to hurt yourself.

Hey, for your information, I could have been great at basketball if I hadn't focused on my passion for paleontology. And speaking of passions, look at the snacks on the counter! You really went all out, huh?
Of course! What's a beach day without the perfect snack spread? And that reminds me; I still owe Phoebe for eating the last of my homemade guacamole. She just swooped in like a seagull!
Ha, speaking of Phoebe, why is she giving Chandler that look? Do you remember what was going on there?
If I recall correctly, she was trying to teach him the "true" art of vegetable meditation, so the salad would become, I don't know, more zen? You know Phoebe.
Vegetable meditation? That's as wacky as her theory on gravity being just a suggestion. And there's Rachel, looking like she's right in the middle of a ‘should I intervene’ moment.
Well, you know Rachel. Always caught between enjoying the madness and being the voice of reason. Remember when she tried to convince Joey that mermaids don't have beards?
Oh yeah, and he was all defensive, saying something about 'underwater style'. Absolutely hilarious! That was such a fun day, even with all the cleaning up afterwards.
Yeah, it was. But next time, we're burying you in the sand, and I'm building the sandcastle. We'll see if your paleontological skills help you dig yourself out!
Challenge accepted, Mon. But if I'm getting buried, then we're playing football afterwards. And I'm not talking about soccer—I mean American football.
Ross, whenever you say 'football' all I hear is 'please tackle me'. But you're on. And FYI, I don't go easy on family.

role_info: From left to right are Rachel Green, Phoebe Buffay and Monica Geller.
scene_info: Phoebe breaks up the fight between the two.

conversations.value: Look at this! This is like peering into an alternate universe where I'm the most responsible one. What's going on here with these two hooligans?
That's just Rachel and me fighting over who put orange juice in the cereal box. Can you believe that? I mean, who mistakes the refrigerator for the cupboard?

Sweet lord of the rings! It's as if common sense took a holiday, and in its place, we got... 'Orange Juice Cereal Gate.' But seriously, were you possessed by the spirit of a disoriented breakfast gnome or something?
Ha-ha, very funny, Phoebe. It was an honest mistake, okay? It was early, and I hadn't had my coffee yet. You know how it is, you can't function until the caffeine hits.
I know, without my morning tea, I feel as though my inner goddess is still slumbering. But you — combat mode over OJ cereal? So not the tranquil Monica vibe.
Hey, it's not just about the OJ! That box of cereal was my last one, and she turned it into a soggy mess. It's the principle, and you know how I feel about my kitchen.
Yes. 'Monica Clean' versus 'Rachel Carefree.' Classic kitchen clash of titans! Shove aside, Zeus! But come on, don't you think life's too short to get all scrunched up over chunky cereal?
I guess you're right, Phoebe. I just wish she'd be more careful, you know? It's about respecting the cereal... and the kitchen... and me.

Well, from this photo, it looks like you ended up respecting each other's personal space with your tushies on the floor. Did you hug it out, or did it end in Monica declaring martial law over kitchen territory?
No, no martial law. We hugged it out. And I made her promise to triple-check before she pours anything from now on. You have to compromise, right? Besides, I can't stay mad at her.
Exactly! Because when life gives you soggy cereal, you make... I don't know, cereal soup? Ew, no, that's gross. But you know what I mean.)viewDidLoad

role_info: From left to right are Joey Tribbiani and Chandler Bing.

conversations.value: Oh my god, Mon, look at this! Can you believe Joey and Chandler's apartment? What happened?
I know! It's like the barren wasteland of furniture. Just look at them sitting in that canoe.
I know, right? It's actually kind of sad but hilarious at the same time. I mean, who steals a canoe?
Technically, the canoe's the only thing left because no one would bother to steal it. And looks at Chandler's face – oh my god, it screams 'Could I BE any more boat-less?'
He always has the best lines. But Joey looks so lost, I almost want to give him a hug. And then clean that place up because it's giving me the creeps.

Ha! Trust you to think about cleaning at a time like this. But honestly, I can't stand the sight of that empty room. It's like all my life, I've been told everything has a place and clearly, their stuff did not get that memo.
They must feel so violated, Mon. Remember when my apartment got robbed? I wanted to move back in with you immediately!
Yeah, but you stayed because that's when you declared your independence, remember? "No more being a shoe!"
That's right! Look at me now, huh? If those guys can handle this, I can handle anything.
Absolutely, Rach. And you know what we should do? We should help them out. Y'know, organize a furniture drive or something?
That's actually a great idea! Or we could find them a couple of barcaloungers, just to see the look on Joey's face.
Perfect! And this time, we're bolting everything to the floor. Let's turn this tragic canoe situation into a victory!
Mon, you're a genius. Let's go shopping! And maybe we can sneak in a little bit of canoe paddling lessons for the boys, just in case.
Deal! But if we're doing this, that apartment is getting cleaned top to bottom first. It’s going to be Monica clean.
You and your cleaning obsession, Mon. Let's do it. But remember, we're doing this for them, not so you can scrub a floor.
Hey, I can multitask. Help our friends and clean? That's like, the perfect day for me!
Classic Monica. Alright, let’s go commandeer some furniture and turn Chadler's frown upside down!

role_info: From left to right are Chandler Bing and Monica Geller.

conversations.value: Would you look at that? You and Chandler dancing at your wedding—such a beautiful moment, Mon. Doesn't it just make you wanna grab a guitar and sing a love ballad?
Every time I see this photo, I'm reminded of how perfect that day was. I mean, can we talk about my dress? I was totally the star of the wedding—next to Chandler, of course.

You were shining brighter than the top of the Chrysler Building! And that dress... it's like it was made by the goddess of elegance herself. Do you ever just put it on and dance around the house pretending you’re at a ball?
I wish! That dress is safely stored away. But I'm not gonna lie, I've definitely had fantasies about another dance in it. Maybe for an anniversary...
You should do it! Dance in moonlight, with a breeze coming through the windows—oh, the spirits would love that!
Spirits, huh? Maybe you can come and do one of your cleansing rituals. I wouldn't want any bad juju on my special night.
Absolutely, leave it to me. I'll bring sage, and maybe some crystals to amplify the love energy.
Just as long as you don't bring that "Smelly Cat," I’ll be happy. Can you imagine? Me in my dress, dancing with Chandler, and there's "Smelly Cat" serenading us in the background?
Hey, "Smelly Cat" might be a love song for the right couple. But okay, for you and Chandler, I'll think of something more... appropriate.
Thanks, Phoebe. Hey, remember the band that played? They were so good. You and Mike should totally do something like that when you have your big day.
We might just elope to Vegas and have the first Elvis we see be the witness. But who knows, I'm full of surprises!
Just promise me you'll let me cater it, wherever it is. I need to be involved and you know how I get with parties.
How could I forget? It's like, "Hi, I’m Monica and if it's not 110% perfect, I'm going to a corner to cry and rebuild my entire life philosophy."
Phoebe! But honestly... yes, that’s pretty accurate. But enough about me, this photo has me thinking...we need to get the gang and do a reenactment of the wedding!
That would be so much fun! I call dibs on being the one who says weird, cryptic blessings to the happy couple.
As if we would have it any other way. Let’s plan it!

role_info: From left to right are Mike, Rachel Green(bridesmaids) and Phoebe Buffay.

conversations.value: Oh my God, Mon, look at this picture from Phoebe's wedding. Can you believe it's been this long? I just loved those flowers.
I know, right? The arrangements were stunning. It was all so magical, even with the snow and everything.
And the way Mike is looking at Phoebe... Ah, love! It was like we were in one of those fairy tales. Just unreal!
Totally, they are soulmates. And you, Miss Bridesmaid, you looked so incredible, Rachel! That dress was so you.
Thank you, Mon! But it was Phoebe's day. She just glowed. I mean, could she be any more beautiful?
No chance. She was the epitome of a winter wonderland princess. Remember how she was all nervous about Mike's family dog walking her down the aisle and then... it just worked out perfectly?
Yes! Only Phoebe would have a dog as a ring bearer, right? And remember how the band canceled last minute but then...
Joey came through with the 'hand twin' song! Classic Friends wedding craziness. But it was all so Phoebe. The day was just as quirky and lovely as she is.
It’s so sweet it kind of makes you want to get married, doesn't it?
Come on. You know you've always wanted the big fairytale wedding. Me? I’ve always been about the marriage, not just the wedding—although I did rock my wedding to Chandler.
You so did! I mean, if I could find a love like you and Chandler have... speaking of which, how are things with you two going?
Amazing. It’s all about the little things, y'know? He’s still making me laugh every single day. Now, we just need to get you settled with someone deserving of Rachel Green.
Well, one day. Maybe I need to take up playing the guitar in the park or something first.
Ha! Or maybe just avoid dating a guy with a sailboat next time.
Hey, there was nothing wrong with that sailboat—except for, y'know, everything.
Exactly. But hey, we've all been there. Remember, we just have to find your lobster.
My lobster, huh? Gentle with the claws, I hope.
Definitely. And if not, he’ll have to answer to me. No one messes with my best friend.

role_info: From left to right are Ross Geller, Chandler Bing, Monica Geller and Phoebe Buffay.

conversations.value: Whoa, check this out, Mon! Look at Chandler's face; he's so... squished!
Huh, yeah... It's like if his face was a sandwich, it would definitely not have enough filling.
Ha! Good one. I wonder what they're listening to. It must be something juicy for them to be this stealth mode.
I bet it's something that could totally change the game—like discovering a secret ingredient in a five-star recipe.
Food secrets are the best secrets. Remember when you found out I secretly ate your leftover lasagna and tried to replace it with a store one?
How could I forget? Nobody messes with my lasagna, Joey!
Yeah, I learned that the hard way. Anyway, I think Ross looks kinda like he's just seen a UFO or something. His eyes are all bugged out!
That's classic Ross for you. And Phoebe, well, she looks like she's just so done with all the sneaking around.
Yeah, well, if it were me in this hotel spying on someone, you know I wouldn't be this quiet. I'd be all, "How you doin'?" and give us away!
Joey, you would 'How you doin'?' a wall if you thought it had ears. But seriously, we can't disturb them; they might be on the verge of finding out something big!
True, true. I gotta learn how to do that eavesdroppy thing. It could come in handy... you know, for acting research.
Right, "acting research." Well, if they find out something good, you know they're going to come straight here and spill. And I'll have the best snacks ready for the gossip session!
Monica, you're always the hostess. And I'm always ready to eat! So, this plan...it's a good plan.
It's not just a good plan, Joey. It's a Monica plan. Now put that eager stomach of yours on pause until they get back, okay?
Can do, Mon. But you gotta promise me you'll make those little pizza bagels I love so much!
Deal. But only if you don't try to eavesdrop on my phone calls with Chandler. I know you, Joey Tribbiani.
Hey, I’m a tribbiani of my word. But you know...if I just happen to overhear something sometime, it's all a moo point.
It's moot, Joey, moot. But let's just focus on the masterplan for now. Operation 'Feed Joey and Get the Scoop' is a go.

role_info: From left to right are Rachel Green and Ross Geller.
scene_info: Ross and Rachel meet for the first time awkwardly.

conversations.value: Do you remember the first time Ross saw Rachel in that dress? It was like watching a deer caught in the very stylish headlights of a runaway train of bridal proportions.

Absolutely. The look on his face was priceless – somewhere between utter shock and 'hello, I'm available!'. And there she was, all runaway bride and yet still somehow... managing to stop at every chocolate store along the way.
Could she BE wearing any more white? I mean, she's about a tiara short of turning into an ice cream sundae mascot.
Chandler! That's my best friend you're talking about. Although, to be fair, she did kind of look like she was auditioning for a part in 'Swans on the Run: A Ballet Gone Wrong.'

It's the part where she just waltzed into Central Perk, gripping that wedding bouquet like her life depended on it. It's amazing how flowers can simultaneously scream, 'I just ditched my wedding!' and 'Any eligible bachelors with good hair?’

Well, it turned into the best decision she ever made. Without that moment, she might never have joined our group. No Rachel? Imagine all the extra coffee you could've had without her around hogging our couch.
And think of the peace and quiet we would have missed without Ross's 'We were on a break!' every five minutes.
True, every moment here is a scene for the books. And speaking of scenes, how cute is it that Ross tried to look so smooth picking up that umbrella? As if it made him any less gobsmacked.
He was trying to be the knight in shining armor, but ended up looking more like... Sir Stumbles-a-lot of Rainydom.
I should have known you couldn't go three minutes without a sarcastic comment. But I have to agree; it's kind of endearing how awkward he was.
Endearing is one word for it. Me? I would have gone with 'destined for a lifetime of dance-related injuries'. Thank goodness I married you – I don't do 'graceful' under pressure.
Yeah, well, we have our own special brand of awkwardness, don't we? And speaking of special, how about we toast to these unexpected but unforgettable beginnings?
To beginnings and to not wearing more clothes than the average arctic explorer on your wedding day.

role_info: From left to right are Ross's Chinese girlfriend, Ross Geller, Chandler Bing, Rachel Green and Monica Geller.
scene_info: Ross introduces his Chinese girlfriend to everyone.

conversations.value: Oh my gosh, look at Ross with his new girlfriend, Julie, right? Is it weird seeing your brother with someone like this?
Yeah, it's a little weird. But I just want Ross to be happy, you know? Julie seems nice, even though it happened so fast after his divorce.
Yeah, of course, I totally support him too. She has killer style, I'll give her that. I mean, look at her outfit, it’s very... chic.
Absolutely. I mean if you're going to fly all the way from China, you've gotta look good stepping off that plane, right? And between you and me, I think her coming all this way says a lot.
Definitely. It's just a lot to take in with how... cozy they look together. Do you think it's serious?
Knowing Ross? He probably already planned out their wedding colors, and their kids' names. You know, typical Ross stuff.
And there's Chandler trying to play it cool. He always has that slightly awkward stance when there's, like, an emotional thing happening.
For sure! Chandler and emotional situations, they mix as well as, well, me and a relaxed approach to organizing my kitchen cabinets. Not happening!
You know, Mon, I'm really proud of us – just standing here, being totally mature and not at all jealous. Totally handling this like the sophisticated women we are.
Yep, sophistication is our middle name. Oh, who am I kidding? Is it just me, or is the room getting smaller because my brother is in here with his girlfriend and it's just suddenly really crowded?
No, it's not just you. I think it must be your "Monica clean" - No dirt, no clutter, and apparently no room for extra emotional baggage either!
Exactly, Rach. Now, come on. Let's go over there and do the whole 'friendly greet' thing. But first, tell me, on a scale of one to 'Monica', how good are my hosting skills right now?
You're a total 'Monica' right now, but maybe aim for 'Monica light'—for Ross's sake.
